text: Gregory T. Goins (born June 7, 1986) is an American UFO and UAP researcher and writer. He studies and talks about unidentified flying object (UFO) and unidentified aerial phenomena (UAP). Goins has been interviewed by national news sources like The Wall Street Journal, Fox News, and The Philadelphia Inquirer about UAPs and drone activity. He also speaks out for more open information from the American government about UAPs. == Early life and education == Goins was born in Stratford, New Jersey, on June 7, 1986. He got a bachelor’s degree in communication, journalism, and media studies from Rutgers University in 2010. == Career == Goins owns part of a title company in Piscataway, New Jersey. He talks publicly about UFO and UAP reports in the area. He has written about these topics and appeared in news stories, especially about sightings in Somerset County. He has been on Fox News to talk about strange drone activity. He was also featured in a Wall Street Journal article about how the federal government is reacting to the problem. == Advocacy == Goins wants the U.S. government to share more about UAPs with the public. In 2024, he started a GoFundMe campaign to send UAP-related materials to members of Congress. These included Luis Elizondo’s book Imminent and the UAP Disclosure Act. == Personal life == Goins lives in Somerset County, New Jersey, with his wife and daughter. == References == Category:Living people Category:1986 births Category:American writers Category:Ufologists Category:People from New Jersey Category:Rutgers University alumni
title: Greg Goins
